entry.title: Morning Worship - Sunday, 22nd February 2026 - Revd Dr Jane Kaluba - #AllAreWelcome

author.name: Trinity High Wycombe and Cores End URCs

media:group.media:title: Morning Worship - Sunday, 22nd February 2026 - Revd Dr Jane Kaluba - #AllAreWelcome
media:group.media:description:
Worship led by Revd Dr Jane Kaluba
00:00 - Music before the service
Entry of the bible
Welcome and lighting of peace candle (Duty Elder)
Call to Worship: Psalm 32
Hymn: O Worship the King all glorious above (R&S 47)
Prayers of Approach and Confession and Lord’s Prayer
First Reading: Romans 5:12-19 read by Johnny Graves (Chesham)
Talk for all ages (followed by Prayer) Dear God, help us do what Jesus did. Help us do what the Bible tells us to do instead of listening to what the devil wants us to do. In Jesus’ name. Amen.
Hymn: Amazing Grace How Sweet the Sound (R & S 92)
Blessing the Junior Church for their activities: May the Lord bless you, And also with you. Amen.
Dedication of Offering
Second Reading: Mathew 4:1-11 read by Marie Willingham (Cores End)
Sermon
Hymn: Seek ye first the Kingdom of God (R & S 512)
Prayers of Intercession Response: Lord in your mercy, Hear our prayer
Hymn: What a friend we have in Jesus (R &S 413)
Blessing
Music after the service

media:group.media:title: Morning Worship - Sunday, 15th February 2026 - #AllAreWelcome
media:group.media:description:
Worship led by Kate Yates Organist: Charles Brewster
01:42 - Entry of the bible
01:52 - Welcome and lighting of peace candle (Duty Elder)
03:06 - Call to worship: Ps 34 1 – 3 From Psalm 34 – please respond with the words in bold I will extol the LORD at all times; his praise will always be on my lips. I will glory in the LORD; let the afflicted hear and rejoice. Glorify the LORD with me; let us exalt his name together.
03:48 - Hymn R&S 74 Praise to the Lord, the Almighty, the King of Creation
07:08 - Opening Prayers and the Lord’s Prayer
09:21 - Introduction to the theme
10:49 - 11:21 - Reading: 2 Samuel 22:3-4 Contemporary English Version read by Abigail Lokko
11:36 - 14:29 - Reading: Luke 10.25-37 Contemporary English Version read by Alan Yates

17:27 - Dedication of gifts, money, talents, time
18:13 - 29:32 - Address “Not my concern” followed by a time of quiet reflection

32:35 - 38:24 - Prayers for ourselves and others
38:39 - Hymn: R&S 200 The kingdom of god is justice and joy
41:22 - 41:46 - Blessing
42:12 - 45:25 - Music after the service

media:group.media:title: Morning Worship - Sunday, 18th January 2026 - #CafeChurch
media:group.media:description:
Worship led by Alan Yates
00:00 - Music before the service
02:48 - Entry of the Bible
02:57 - Welcome and lighting of the peace candle
04:05 - Introduction
04:37 - WE APPROACH GOD CALL TO WORSHIP - Psalm 40:1-3, 9 & 10 I waited patiently for God to help me; then he listened and heard my cry. He lifted me out of the pit of despair, out from the bog and the mire, and set my feet on a hard, firm path, and steadied me as I walked along. He has given me a new song to sing, of praises to our God. Now many will hear of the glorious things he did for me, and stand in awe before the Lord, and put their trust in him.
I have told everyone the good news that you forgive people’s sins. I have not been timid about it, as you well know, O Lord. I have not kept this good news hidden in my heart, but have proclaimed your loving-kindness and truth to all the congregation.
06:46 - 11:06 - HYMN Great God, your love has called us here.
11:12 - Introduction to the theme
12:34 - PRAYERS LORD'S PRAYER (Modern Version)
WE LISTEN FOR GOD’S WORD
16:34 - Introduction to the readings
20:40 - 21:36 - READING 1 – Matthew 4:18-22 Read by: Harri
21:42 - 22:39 - READING 2 – Mark 1:16-20 Read by: Harri
22:45 - 34:10 - FIRST ACTIVITY
34:18 - HYMN – Dear Lord and Father of mankind.
39:00 - 40:29 - READING 3 - Luke 5:1-11 Read by: Tony
40:32 - 41:39 - READING 4 - John 1:35-42 Read by Tony
41:45 - 51:30 - SECOND ACTIVITY
51:47 - 54:31 - HYMN – Come living God when least ex-pected.
54:35 - 01:04:36 - THIRD ACTIVITY
WE MAKE OUR RESPONSE
OFFERTORY Prayer
01:04:45 - 01:08:51 - PRAYERS of intercession - Kate
WE GO OUT TO SERVE
01:09:10 - 01:12:04 - HYMN – Forth in thy name, O Lord, I go.
01:12:21 - 01:12:39 - BLESSING
01:12:56 - 01:16:14 - Music after the service

media:group.media:title: Morning Worship - Sunday, 11th January 2026 - #AllAreWelcome
media:group.media:description:
Worship led by Andrea Smyth Organist: Angus Massie
00:00 - Music before the service
07:39 - Welcome and lighting of peace candle (Duty Elder)
09:03 - Call to worship
09:33 - Hymn: R&S 184 As with Gladness (tune: Dix)
12:51 - Opening Prayers The Lord’s Prayer
15:57 - Hymn: R&S 195 Lord of the Dance (tune: Shaker)
19:31 - 24:40 - Introduction to the Theme
25:09 - 26:52 - Reading: Isaiah 42:1-9 (The Servant of the Lord) read by Ian Bogart
26:57 - 27:52 - Reading: Mattthew 3:13-17 (The Baptism of Jesus) read by Lesley Bogart
Blessing Junior Church for their activities: May the Lord be with you: and also with you. Amen.
28:42 - 31:03 - Hymn: R&S 201 O Sing a Song of Bethlehem (tune: Kingsfold)
31:13 - Dedication of offertory (no offertory is taken up)
31:46 - 46:52 - Talk followed by a time of quiet reflection The sermon, delivered on the first Sunday of Epiphany, explores the profound significance of the Baptism of Jesus as a pivotal moment of revelation and divine identity. Drawing from the readings in Isaiah 42 and Matthew 3, the talk reflects on how Jesus’ immersion in the Jordan River represents his solidarity with humanity and the beginning of his public ministry. The speaker emphasizes that the water of baptism serves as a powerful symbol of repentance, being cleansed of sin, and—most importantly—our adoption into God’s family. By highlighting the heavenly voice that declared Jesus as the "beloved Son," the message encourages the congregation to find their own identity and purpose in that same divine love, living as followers of Christ who carry his light into the world.
47:03 - Hymn: R&S 92 Amazing Grace (tune: Amazing Grace)
50:25 - 52:19 - Prayers for others and ourselves
52:31 - 56:11 - Hymn: R&S 573 God is Working His Purpose Out (tune: Benson)
56:19 - 56:43 - Closing blessing
56:52 - 58:54 - Music after the service

author.name: Trinity High Wycombe and Cores End URCs

media:group.media:title: Morning Worship - 28th December 2025 - #AllAreWelcome
media:group.media:description:
Worship led by: Stephen Burton Organist: Angus Massey
00:00:00 - Music before the service
07:36 - Entry of the bible
07:49 - Welcome and lighting of peace candle (Duty Elder)
09:25 - Call to worship: Psalm 148 vv 1 – 5
10:20 - 14:29 - Hymn: 181 Of the fathers love begotten
14:35 - Opening Prayers The Lord’s Prayer
18:00 - Introduction to the Bible readings
18:17 - 20:30 - Reading: Matthew 2 vv 13 - 23
20:40 - 24:45 - Talk for all ages: Reflecting on the incredible dedication of emergency services—including the police, fire crews, and RNLI—this talk explores the parallel of Jesus as "God’s Rescuer." It examines how Christ does not merely provide instructions from a distance but enters directly into the human experience to offer support through moments of sadness, guilt, and struggle.
24:56 - 27:17 - Hymn: 169 Unto us a boy is born
27:37 - 29:09 - Reading: Hebrews 2 vv 10 - 18
Blessing Junior Church for their activities: May the Lord be with you: and also with you. Amen.
Dedication of offertory (no offertory is taken up)
30:22 - 33:21 - Hymn: 371 Take my life and let it be
33:54 - 43:08 - Address followed by a time of quiet reflection Examines the "mixture of joy and pain" inherent in the season, noting how the "shadow of the cross" rests over the nativity crib. By looking at the Holy Family’s experience as refugees, the talk highlights how God enters the world as it truly is, choosing to remain present through suffering and carry people through their distress.
43:24 - Hymn: 146 Away in a manger
45:17 - 49:29 - Prayers for others and ourselves
49:44 - 54:18 - Hymn: 162 In the bleak mid-winter
54:18 - 54:42 - Closing blessing
55:06 - 57:31 - Music after the service

media:group.media:title: Carol Service - 21st December 4pm GMT
media:group.media:description:
Carol Service 21st December 2025 at 4pm. Organist: Charles Brewster.
01:55 - Welcome 06:15 - Lighting of the advent candles 06:48 - Introduction and explanation of the service format
07:03 - 14:00 - Hymn - O Come, O come Immanuel 14:02 - 15:07 - Prayer
15:23 - 17:47 - The First Lesson: Genesis 4:3-16 17:50 - Thought on violence in the world
19:00 - 22:34 - Hymn - Once in Royal David's City 22:36 - 24:18 - The Second Lesson: Psalm 42 24:19 - Thoughts on hope
24:33 - 28:52 - Hymn - In the bleak midwinter 29:02 - 30:11 - The Third Lesson: Micah 6:6-12 30:20 - Thoughts on God's call to justice
30:49 - 33:26 - Hymn - Silent night 33:33 - 34:40 - The Fourth Lesson: Isaiah 61:1-4 34:42 - Change lives in the DR. Congo with her 8 children
35:49 - 38:49 - Hymn - The Angel Gabriel from Heaven came 39:09 - 40:16 - The Fifth Lesson: Luke 1:46-55
40:19 - 42:51 - Hymn - See him lying on a bed of straw 42:58 - 43:48 - The Sixth Lesson: Luke 2:1-7 43:40 - 44:50 - Reflecting on the gifts we give to one another
44:53 - 48:34 - Hymn - It came upon the midnight clear 48:39 - 50:40 - The Seventh Lesson: Luke 2:8-20 50:42 - Shephering and farming communities today and how the climate crisis affects them.
51:15 - 52:03 - Hymn - Away in a manger 53:08 - 54:57 - The Eighth Lesson: Matthew 2:1-12 54:59 - 55:46 - How power can be used to intimidate and destroy others.
55:47 - 58:24 - Hymn - Joy to the world 58:30 - 01:00:11 - The Ninth Lesson: John 1:1-4 01:00:13 - 01:01:58 - Love and justice hold hands and the world holds its breath.
01:02:09 - 01:05:16 - Hymn - Hark the herald angels sing 01:05:17 - 01:05:37 - Blessing
01:06:00 - 01:08:32 - Music after the service

entry.title: Morning Worship - Sunday, 30th November 2025 - 1st Sunday in Advent

author.name: Trinity High Wycombe and Cores End URCs

media:group.media:title: Morning Worship - Sunday, 30th November 2025 - 1st Sunday in Advent
media:group.media:description:
Worship led by John Shaw Organist: Angus Massie
00:00 - Music before the service
08:38 - Entry of the bible
08:55 - Welcome and lighting of peace candle (Duty Elder)
11:44 - Lighting of Advent Candle • Reading: John 1 v1-5 • Lighting of first candle for Advent • Prayer
14:03 - Hymn: R&S 138 – Come thou long expected Jesus (tune: Stuttgart)
15:56 - 20:52 - Introductory Talk: “Happy New Year!”
Opening Prayers The Lord’s Prayer
21:08 - Hymn: Longing for light, we wait in darkness tune: Christ be our light)
Blessing Junior Church for their activities: May the Lord be with you: and also with you. Amen.
Introduction to the Bible readings
26:08 - 27:51 - Reading: Matthew 24 v36-44 read by Abigail
27:57 - 29:41 - Reading: Romans 13 v8-14 read by Abigail
30:12 - Hymn: R&S 656 – Lo, he comes with clouds descending (tune: Helmsley)
35:49 - 55:54 - Address followed by a time of quiet reflection
56:15 - Hymn: R&S 265 I cannot tell why he, whom angels worship (tune: Londonderry Air)
Dedication of offertory (no offertory is taken up)
01:01:30 - 01:07:55 - Prayers for others and ourselves
01:08:09 - Hymn: R&S 579: Lord thy church on earth is seeking (tune: Abbots Leigh)
01:11:19 - 01:11:39 - Closing blessing
01:11:51 - 01:14:00 - Music after the service

media:group.media:title: Morning Worship - Sunday, 23rd November 2025
media:group.media:description:
Worship led by Angus Massie Organist:: Charles Brewster
00:00 - Music before the service
04:59 - Entry of the Bible
05:10 - Welcome and Lighting of The Peace Candle
07:09 - Introduction to the service
08:23 - 11:50 - Introduction to the Hymn:Holy, Holy, Holy 11:58 - 15:27 - Hymn: 34 – Holy, Holy, Holy
16:09 - 18:19 - Opening Prayers & The Lord’s Prayer
18:26 - 22:20 - Introduction to the Hymn:For the beauty of the earth 22:21 - Hymn: 41 – For the beauty of the earth
26:32 - 28:06 - Reading: Jeremiah Ch 23 (1-6) - read by Ian Bogart
28:17 - 32:59 - Introduction to the Hymn:Glorious things of Thee are spoken 33:13 - 36:13 - Hymn: 560 Glorious things of Thee are spoken (Austria - 98 )
36:37 - 37:58 - Reading: Psalm 46 - read by Lesley Bogart
Blessing Junior Church for their activities: May the Lord be with you: and also with you. Amen.
38:20 - 46:50 - Introduction to the Hymn:O God of Bethel 47:08 - 49:42 - Hymn: 71 - O God of Bethel (Saltzburg)
49:47 - Dedication of offertory (no offertory is taken up)
50:41 - 54:59 - Introduction to the Hymn:We are not our own 55:20 - 57:53 - Hymn: 482 – We are not our own
58:24 - 01:01:16 - Prayers for others and ourselves
01:01:26 - 01:07:06 - Introduction to the Hymn:Ye gates, lift up your heads 01:07:13 - 01:10:10 - Hymn: 681 – Ye gates, lift up your heads
01:10:13 - 01:10:33 - Closing blessing
01:11:00 - 01:15:30 - Music after the service

media:group.media:title: Morning Worship - Sunday, 16th November 2025
media:group.media:description:
Worship led by Alastair Frew, Organist:: Charles Brewster
00:00 - Music before the service
06:10 - Entry of the Bible
06:22 - Welcome and Lighting of The Peace Candle
07:55 - Call to worship
08:28 - HYMN: 543 Lead us Heavenly Father lead us (tune: )
10:40 - Opening Prayers The Lord’s Prayer
13:01 - Introduction to the Bible readings
13:38 - 14:21 - Reading: Genesis 29: 1-3
14:33 - 20:05 - Talk for all ages: the Col de la Madeleine
20:28 - 22:14 - Reading: John 4: 1-14
23:03 - Blessing Junior Church for their activities: May the Lord be with you: and also with you. Amen.
23:27 - 26:09 - Hymn: 548 Nothing distress you (tune: )
26:14 - Dedication of offertory (no offertory is taken up)
26:54 - 29:47 - Hymn: 552 The King of love my shepherd is (tune: )
30:03 - 47:06 - Address – Bernard and Cnut followed by a time of quiet reflection
47:45 - Hymn: HYMN: 551 O for a closer walk with God (tune:)
50:53 - 54:26 - Prayers for others and ourselves
54:51 - 57:04 - Hymn: 558 Will you come and follow me? (tune: )
57:05 - 57:27 - Closing blessing
57:49 - 01:02:03 - Music after the service

author.name: Trinity High Wycombe and Cores End URCs

media:group.media:title: Morning Worship - Sunday, 9th November 2025
media:group.media:description:
Worship led by Members of the Tuesday Meeting Organist: Charles Brewster
Remembrance Sunday
00:00 - Music before the service
05:51 - Entry of the Bible
06:45 - Welcome and Lighting of The Peace Candle
08:34 - Call to Worship God is our refuge and strength, a very present help in trouble Psalm 46 vv 1 I will lift up my eyes to the hills from whence will my help come? My help comes from the Lord, who made heaven and earth. Psalm 122 vv 1 – 2
09:23 - 13:00 - Hymn: O worship the King all glorious above
13:07 - Prayer of Confession
15:46 - 16:34 - Poem: In Flanders Fields
16:53 - 19:23 - Reading: Luke 20 vv 27 – 38
19:55 - 24:55 - Talk for all ages: Memorial plaque in Trinity
25:36 - Hymn:O God our help in ages past
The Two Minute Silence 29:47 - They shall grow not old as we that are left grow old: Age shall not weary them, nor the years condemn. At the going down of the sun and in the morning, we will remember them. WE WILL REMEMBER THEM.
Last Post Silence Reveille
33:37 - When you go home, tell them of us and say, for your tomorrow we gave our today.
34:04 - 38:01 - Hymn:Great is thy faithfulness
38:19 - 39:09 - Reading: Job 19 vv 23 – 27a
39:27 - 47:07 - Address
47:24 - 50:30 - Hymn: Eternal Father, strong to save
50:56 - 53:50 - Prayers of Intersession The Lord’s Prayer
54:58 - Hymn: Lord for the years
58:42 - 59:13 - Closing blessing
59:36 - 01:03:16 - Music after the service
